title: 1188This and announcing retirement. Long week for Nancy.posted5 days agobyWaylan39 commentsawardshar

39 comments Sort by Top Top New Worst Old Save DeusVult1096 43 points 5 days ago She will never truly retire. This hag will keep working behind the scenes like Obama. permalink award report block reply LabTech 13 points 5 days ago Right, if anything this signals an uptick in activity for her, because she needs to spend the next year doing everything she can to destroy the country in the leadup to the Midterms, and can't be bothered with that pesky distraction of running the country. If the Dems lose the MIdterms, they're basically finished as a national party on the Federal level, and they'd be lucky to be left with the rotting urban core enclaves they've held for decades.  The Dems who are coming up through the system to replace the Boomers are true believers who don't understand that the woke crap was just a scam to get the public compliant, not an actual philosophy to live their lives by.  Once the last of her generation are gone, and it frankly can't come soon enough, they won't be able to even wipe their own rears. permalink parent award report block reply ckover9000 4 points 5 days ago Exactly. This only means she has some shit planned that she can't be under the constraints of being a "public servant." Should be equally legal to throw sandwiches at judges for ummm... protesting for illegal's legal rights or something permalink parent award report block reply YearninNation 2 points 5 days ago San Francisco Democrats in the 1970s had significant political ties to Jim Jones, the leader of the Peoples Temple, which later ended in the mass suicide at Jonestown in 1978.
Jones cultivated strong relationships with prominent Democratic figures, leveraging his ability to deliver large numbers of followers for rallies, campaign work, and voter turnout, which made him a valuable political ally. Mayor George Moscone, whose 1975 mayoral victory was allegedly aided by voter fraud involving Peoples Temple members bused in to vote multiple times, appointed Jones to the San Francisco Housing Authority Commission and later made him its chairman, effectively making Jones the city’s largest landlord.
Moscone likely owed his election to Jones and the Temple’s political support. Other key Democrats also embraced Jones. Assemblyman Willie Brown, who later became Speaker of the California Assembly and mayor of San Francisco, compared Jones to Martin Luther King Jr., Mahatma Gandhi, and Chairman Mao, calling him a “close personal friend and a highly trusted brother in the struggle for liberation”.
Harvey Milk, the city supervisor and gay rights activist, wrote Jones a letter expressing deep admiration, stating, “The first time I heard you, you made a statement: ‘Take one of us, and you must take all of us.’ Please add my name”.
Milk referred to Jones as having “greatness” and actively sought his political endorsement. Dianne Feinstein, then a member of the San Francisco Board of Supervisors, joined her colleagues in honoring Jones “in recognition of his guidance and inspiration” in advancing humanitarian programs.
Nancy Pelosi, who was then the chair of the California Democratic Party for Northern California, was also part of the political circle that supported Jones. At the national level, Jones met privately with Rosalynn Carter during the 1976 presidential campaign and introduced her at a campaign event.
Vice-presidential candidate Walter Mondale also held a private meeting with Jones upon landing in San Francisco. permalink award report block reply Seruna_Kanus 1 points 5 days ago I would imagine subway would love short stocks. permalink award report block reply Speedgraphic69 1 points 5 days ago Water skiing on the Lake of Fire with John McCain and Dickhead Cheney permalink award report block reply Aggrieved03 1 points 5 days ago Pajeet owned. permalink award report block reply Thunnus73 1 points 5 days ago Bela Pelosi's House On The Hill https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i043gWMKAVg permalink award report block reply USNVET71 -1 points 5 days ago What a disgusting evil cunt permalink award report block reply SteveBannonsNckbeard -2 points 5 days ago Pretty low effort/retarded meme. YearninNation 2 points 5 days ago San Francisco Democrats in the 1970s had significant political ties to Jim Jones, the leader of the Peoples Temple, which later ended in the mass suicide at Jonestown in 1978.
Jones cultivated strong relationships with prominent Democratic figures, leveraging his ability to deliver large numbers of followers for rallies, campaign work, and voter turnout, which made him a valuable political ally. Mayor George Moscone, whose 1975 mayoral victory was allegedly aided by voter fraud involving Peoples Temple members bused in to vote multiple times, appointed Jones to the San Francisco Housing Authority Commission and later made him its chairman, effectively making Jones the city’s largest landlord.
Moscone likely owed his election to Jones and the Temple’s political support. Other key Democrats also embraced Jones. Assemblyman Willie Brown, who later became Speaker of the California Assembly and mayor of San Francisco, compared Jones to Martin Luther King Jr., Mahatma Gandhi, and Chairman Mao, calling him a “close personal friend and a highly trusted brother in the struggle for liberation”.
Harvey Milk, the city supervisor and gay rights activist, wrote Jones a letter expressing deep admiration, stating, “The first time I heard you, you made a statement: ‘Take one of us, and you must take all of us.’ Please add my name”.
Milk referred to Jones as having “greatness” and actively sought his political endorsement. Dianne Feinstein, then a member of the San Francisco Board of Supervisors, joined her colleagues in honoring Jones “in recognition of his guidance and inspiration” in advancing humanitarian programs.
Nancy Pelosi, who was then the chair of the California Democratic Party for Northern California, was also part of the political circle that supported Jones. At the national level, Jones met privately with Rosalynn Carter during the 1976 presidential campaign and introduced her at a campaign event.
Vice-presidential candidate Walter Mondale also held a private meeting with Jones upon landing in San Francisco. permalink award report block reply
